test.name: Does the RP Authentication Request's JWT contain a correct 'acr_values' parameter
test.description: The Authentication request is taken, the JWT Token in the request parameter base64url decoded and the presence of the 'acr_values' parameter is checked. If it is present, than it must be a string with the requested 'acr' values, each of them separated by a single space. The supported values are 'https://www.spid.gov.it/SpidL1', 'https://www.spid.gov.it/SpidL2' and 'https://www.spid.gov.it/SpidL3'. If it contains other values or it is missing, than the RP is not compliant with the specifications

test.name: Does the RP Authentication Request's JWT contain the 'prompt' parameter
test.description: The Authentication request is taken, the JWT Token in the request parameter base64url decoded and the 'prompt' parameter is checked. It must be set to the value 'consent' or 'consent login'. If it contains other values or it is missing, than the RP is not compliant with the specifications

test.name: Does the RP Authentication Request contain a correct value in 'scope' parameter
test.description: The Authentication request is taken, the JWT Token in the request parameter base64url decoded and the value of the 'scope' parameter must be set to the value 'openid' then it can (optionally) have the values 'offline_access', 'profile' or 'email' appended.
